audit_content.question_text: Is the Factory License valid and current for the present year?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for the original 'Factory License' (Form 4 or State equivalent). Check the 'Valid Until' date. If expired, ask for proof of renewal application.

penalty_details.description: Operating without a license is a criminal offence.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the current Factory License or Renewal Receipt.

audit_content.question_text: Is the Abstract of the Factories Act and Rules displayed at the main entrance?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for the large official poster (Form 20 equivalent). It must be in English AND the local language understood by the majority. Check if it is clean and legible.

penalty_details.description: General penalty for contravention under Section 92.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a clear photo of the Notice Board at the main entrance.

audit_content.question_text: Are the names and addresses of the Inspector and Certifying Surgeon displayed?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check the notice board for specific contact details of the Area Inspector and the Factory Medical Officer (Certifying Surgeon). These must be current.

penalty_details.description: General penalty for contravention under Section 92.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a close-up photo of the contact details section on the notice board.

audit_content.question_text: Are dirt and refuse removed daily from floors, benches, staircases, and passages?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check if the sweeping schedule confirms daily cleaning. Visually inspect corners and under benches for old dust accumulation.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the cleaning register or a clean workroom floor.

audit_content.question_text: Is the floor of every workroom washed with disinfectant at least once a week?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for the cleaning log. Look for entries specifying 'washing' or 'wet mopping' with disinfectant, not just sweeping.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a copy of the weekly washing log.

audit_content.question_text: Are effective drainage means provided where floors become wet during manufacturing?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If the process involves water (e.g., dyeing, washing), check if the floor slopes toward a drain and if the drain is unblocked.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the drainage system in wet areas.

audit_content.question_text: Is there adequate ventilation by fresh air circulation in workrooms?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check if windows open, or if fans/ACs are working. The air shouldn't feel stagnant or suffocating.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of ventilation equipment (fans/vents).

audit_content.question_text: Are effective measures taken to prevent the inhalation of dust or fumes?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for exhaust hoods near machines that create dust. Check if workers are coughing or if there is visible haze.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of local exhaust ventilation (LEV) systems.

audit_content.question_text: Is there at least 14.2 cubic meters of space for every worker employed in the room?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Visually assess if workers are packed too tightly. If it looks crowded, we need measurements. (Note: 9.9 cubic meters for pre-1948 factories).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Calculate Room Volume / Max Workers.

audit_content.question_text: Are glazed windows and skylights kept clean and free from obstruction?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check if windows are painted over, blocked by stacks of boxes, or covered in grime that blocks light.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of windows.

audit_content.question_text: Is there a sufficient supply of wholesome drinking water provided?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check if the water dispensers are working and if the water looks clean. Ask for the latest water quality test report.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload latest water potability test certificate.

audit_content.question_text: Are drinking water points legibly marked 'Drinking Water' in a language understood by the majority?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for signs. It must not just be in English if the workers speak Hindi/Tamil/etc.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Drinking Water signage.

audit_content.question_text: Is the drinking water point situated more than 6 meters away from any latrine, urinal, or washing place?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Measure the distance between the water cooler and the nearest toilet door. If < 6m, check if they have a Chief Inspector's exemption.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo showing distance or proximity.

audit_content.question_text: Is separate enclosed accommodation provided for male and female workers?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check for separate rooms with doors. Signs (Men/Women) must be visible. No common entrances without screening.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of male and female toilet entrances.

audit_content.question_text: Are latrines and urinals adequately lighted?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Enter the toilet and close the door. Is it too dark to see clearly? Lights must be functional.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of lighting inside the facility.

audit_content.question_text: Are latrines and urinals adequately ventilated?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check for exhaust fans or windows. There should be no strong foul odors.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of exhaust fan or vents.

audit_content.question_text: Is a notice specifying the penalty for spitting prominently displayed?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for 'No Spitting' signs that mention a fine (usually up to 5 Rupees).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the No Spitting signage.

audit_content.question_text: Are all moving parts of prime movers and flywheels securely fenced?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check engines, motors, and flywheels. There must be a substantial guard preventing anyone from touching moving parts.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the guard installed on the prime mover/flywheel.

audit_content.question_text: Is every part of the transmission machinery (belts, pulleys, shafts) securely fenced?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Walk through the floor. Are there exposed belts or spinning shafts? They must be enclosed in cages or guards.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of guards on transmission belts/shafts.

audit_content.question_text: Do workers examining or lubricating moving machinery wear tight-fitting clothing?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Observe the maintenance staff. Loose shirts, dhotis, or unbuttoned sleeves are prohibited near moving machinery.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of maintenance worker's uniform/clothing.

audit_content.question_text: Are women and young persons prohibited from cleaning or lubricating machinery while it is in motion?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Verify policy and practice. Ensure no woman or adolescent is assigned maintenance tasks on running machines.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload job description or safety policy prohibiting this.

audit_content.question_text: Have young persons working on dangerous machines received sufficient training and supervision?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If adolescents work on presses, saws, or milling machines, check their training records and supervision logs.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload training certificate for the young person.

audit_content.question_text: Is suitable striking gear provided to move driving belts between fast and loose pulleys?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check belt-driven machines. There must be a lever (striking gear) to shift the belt safely, not done by hand.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the striking gear mechanism.

audit_content.question_text: Are devices for cutting off power in emergencies provided in every workroom?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for the red 'Emergency Stop' button or switch. It must be accessible in the room where the machine is running.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Emergency Stop button/switch.

audit_content.question_text: Are all set screws, bolts, and keys on revolving shafts sunk, encased, or guarded?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Inspect rotating shafts. Protruding bolts can catch clothing. They must be recessed (sunk) or covered.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Close-up photo of a revolving shaft showing sunk/guarded bolts.

audit_content.question_text: Are hoists and lifts examined by a competent person at least once every 6 months?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for the 'Hoist Examination Register' (usually Form 11 or similar). Check the last date of inspection.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the last examination certificate for the hoist.

audit_content.question_text: Are hoistways and liftways protected by an enclosure fitted with gates?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: The lift shaft must be fully enclosed so no one can fall in. Gates must be present at every landing.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the hoistway enclosure and gates.

audit_content.question_text: Are hoist gates fitted with interlocking devices?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Try to open the gate when the lift is NOT there. It should not open. Try to move the lift when the gate is open. It should not move.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the interlocking mechanism on the gate.

audit_content.question_text: Are lifting machines, chains, and ropes examined by a competent person every 12 months?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check records for Cranes, Chain Pulley Blocks, etc. Frequency is 12 months (unlike Hoists which is 6).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the 12-monthly examination register.

audit_content.question_text: Is the Safe Working Load (SWL) plainly marked on every lifting machine and tackle?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look at the crane or pulley. It must say something like 'SWL 5 TON'.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the SWL marking on the machine.

audit_content.question_text: Is a notice indicating the maximum safe working peripheral speed affixed near grinding machines?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Go to the grinding wheel area. There must be a plate or notice stating the max RPM or speed.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the speed notice on/near the grinding machine.

audit_content.question_text: Is a valid Hydrostatic Test Certificate available for all pressure vessels?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for the 'Form 13' (Report of Examination of Pressure Vessel). Check if the test date is within the prescribed limit (usually external every 6 months, internal every 12 months, hydrostatic every 2-4 years depending on state rules).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the latest Hydrostatic Test Certificate signed by a Competent Person.

audit_content.question_text: Is the safe working pressure (SWP) marked on the pressure plant?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look at the boiler, compressor tank, or autoclave. There should be a red line on the pressure gauge or a plate stating the max pressure.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the pressure gauge or identification plate.

audit_content.question_text: Are floors, steps, and passages kept free from obstruction and slipping hazards?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Walk the walkways. Are there oil spills, loose wires, or boxes blocking the path?

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of a clear or obstructed walkway.

audit_content.question_text: Are substantial handrails provided for all stairs?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check any staircase. It must have a railing. Shake it gently to ensure it is 'substantial' and not loose.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the staircase handrails.

audit_content.question_text: Are all pits, sumps, and floor openings securely covered or fenced?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for holes in the ground for maintenance or drainage. They must have a heavy cover or a fence around them so no one falls in.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the pit cover or fencing.

audit_content.question_text: Are suitable goggles or effective screens provided for protection of eyes?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check areas with welding, grinding, or chemical splashing. Verify that the company has actually purchased and distributed eye protection.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the goggles available at the station.

audit_content.question_text: Are workers actually using the provided eye protection?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Observe the workers engaged in grinding/welding. Are they wearing the goggles, or are the goggles sitting on the bench?

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of worker performing task (face view).

audit_content.question_text: Is portable electric light used inside confined spaces limited to 24 volts?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If workers enter tanks/pits, check their inspection lamp. It must be low voltage (24V) to prevent electrocution.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the lamp specifications or transformer.

audit_content.question_text: Are safe means of escape provided and kept unlocked/unobstructed?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check all Emergency Exits. They must NOT be locked. The path to them must NOT be blocked by materials.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Emergency Exit door.

audit_content.question_text: Is necessary fire extinguishing equipment provided and maintained?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Look for fire extinguishers. Check the tag - is the 'Next Refill Date' in the future? Is the pressure gauge in the green?

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the fire extinguisher tag/gauge.

audit_content.question_text: Are workers familiar with means of escape and adequately trained (mock drills)?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask a random worker: 'If the alarm rings, where do you go?'. Also, check the register for the last Fire Mock Drill.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload records of the last Fire Mock Drill.

audit_content.question_text: If 1000+ workers are employed (or hazardous process), are Safety Officers appointed?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If the factory is large (1000+) or handles dangerous chemicals, check the payroll for 'Safety Officer'.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload appointment letter/qualification of Safety Officer.

audit_content.question_text: Has information regarding dangers and health hazards been disclosed to the workers?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check if workers handling chemicals know the risks. Look for Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) displayed in local languages.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of displayed safety information/MSDS.

audit_content.question_text: Is there a drawn-up On-Site Emergency Plan and Disaster Control Measure?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for the 'On-Site Emergency Plan' document. It must be approved by the Chief Inspector.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the cover page of the approved Emergency Plan.

audit_content.question_text: Are accurate and up-to-date health/medical records maintained for workers exposed to chemical/toxic substances?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Verify medical files. Every worker in the hazardous process must have a health record (Form 7 or similar) updated yearly.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a sample anonymized health record page.

audit_content.question_text: Are separate and adequately screened washing facilities provided for male and female workers?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check washing areas (sinks/showers). Men and Women must have separate, enclosed areas. Signage must be clear.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the entrances to male/female washing facilities.

audit_content.question_text: Is there at least one first-aid box for every 150 workers?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Count the boxes and the workers. Open a box: Does it contain the prescribed items (bandages, antiseptic, burn cream, etc.)?

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the open first-aid box showing contents.

audit_content.question_text: Is the first-aid box kept in charge of a person holding a recognized certificate in first-aid treatment?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask who is in charge of the box. Do they have a valid First Aid certificate (e.g., St. John Ambulance)? Is this person available during working hours?

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the First Aid Certificate of the responsible person.

audit_content.question_text: If more than 500 workers are employed, is an ambulance room provided?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If Total Workers > 500: Check for a dedicated room with medical staff (nurse/doctor) and equipment (stretcher, oxygen, etc.).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Ambulance Room entrance/interior.

audit_content.question_text: If more than 250 workers are employed, is a canteen provided?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If Total Workers > 250: There must be a functioning canteen serving food/tea. A simple lunch room is not enough.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Canteen facility.

audit_content.question_text: If more than 150 workers are employed, are adequate shelters, rest rooms, or a lunch room provided?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If Total Workers > 150: Workers need a place to eat packed lunch or rest. A canteen fulfills this requirement.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Rest Room/Lunch Room.

audit_content.question_text: If more than 30 women workers are employed, is a crche provided for children under 6 years?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check payroll. If Women > 30, a room for children (crche) is mandatory, even if no children are currently present (unless exempted).

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the Crche facility.

audit_content.question_text: If 500 or more workers are employed, are Welfare Officers employed?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If Total Workers >= 500: Check HR records for the appointment of a designated 'Welfare Officer'.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload appointment letter of the Welfare Officer.

audit_content.question_text: Do adult workers work no more than 48 hours in any week?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Check the attendance register or time cards. Total hours worked (excluding rest intervals) must not exceed 48 per week.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a sample of the weekly time-sheet/attendance log.

audit_content.question_text: Are workers paid twice their ordinary rate of wages for overtime work?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If anyone worked >9 hours/day or >48 hours/week, check their pay slip. The OT rate must be double the normal rate.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload an Overtime Slip or Payroll sheet showing OT calculation.

audit_content.question_text: Is the Register of Adult Workers maintained and available during working hours?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for 'Form 12' (or state equivalent). It must list every adult worker currently in the factory. Verify if recent joiners are added.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload the Register of Adult Workers.

audit_content.question_text: Is the factory free of any child worker who has not completed their 14th year?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Visually scan the floor. If any worker looks under 14, verify their age proof immediately. This is a zero-tolerance item.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Photo of the work floor (general view) or Age Proof documents if questionable.

audit_content.question_text: Do adolescent workers (15-18 years) carry a 'Certificate of Fitness' and wear a token?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: If you see young workers (15-18), ask to see their 'Form 5' Certificate of Fitness and the metal token they should be wearing.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a copy of a Certificate of Fitness (Form 5).

audit_content.question_text: Is a Register of Leave with Wages maintained?
audit_content.simplified_guidance: Ask for 'Form 15' (Leave Register). It must track earned leave (1 day per 20 days work) for every worker.

evidence_requirements.instruction: Upload a page from the Leave with Wages register.
